channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI chip designer Biren’s shares surge 76% on debut in Hong Kong
item.description: Biren’s strong start will likely augur well for two other AI-related stocks—MiniMax and Zhipu—that are set to list in HK next week.

item.title: Behind glam luxury brands Michael Kors and Jimmy Choo lurks a troubled holding company losing millions
item.description: Capri CEO John Idol’s fashion powerhouse of Michael Kors, Versace and Jimmy Choo was supposed to rival LVMH. Seven years in, the company lost $1 billi...

item.title: BYD posts slowest annual sales growth in 5 years, but China’s EV giant is still set to outsell Tesla for the first time
item.description: BYD sold 4.6 million vehicles last year, compared to 4.3 million in 2024. Monthly sales for December dropped by 18.3% year-on-year.

item.title: Could 2026 be the year of the 4-day workweek? Here’s what top business leaders have predicted about the shift
item.description: Business titans from Elon Musk to Bill Gates made bold predictions that the workweek will soon be reduced to four days—or shorter.

item.title: Quran used to swear in New York City’s mayor for the first time in history as Zohran Mamdani takes office
item.description: It dates back to the late 18th or early 19th century and belongs to the New York Public Library’s Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Is ‘Locked and Loaded’ if Iran Kills Protesters
item.description: Mr. Trump’s remarks that he was ready to come to the protesters’ “rescue” are a sharp escalation as protests over economic hardship turned deadly.

item.title: With Obamacare’s Higher Premiums Come Difficult Decisions
item.description: As enhanced subsidies expire, many Americans covered under the Affordable Care Act are having trouble paying for insurance.

item.title: After Watergate, the Presidency Was Tamed. Trump Is Unleashing It.
item.description: In the 1970s, Congress passed a raft of laws to hold the White House accountable. President Trump has decided they don’t apply to him.

item.title: Why a Nuclear Plant Is a Big Sticking Point in the Ukraine Peace Plan
item.description: The Zaporizhzhia plant, occupied by Russia, would be crucial to powering Ukraine’s postwar recovery.

item.title: Swiss Resort Bar Fire: 17-Year-Old Italian Golfer Is One of the First Identified Victims
item.description: Mr. Galeppini, 17, was a promising young golfer from Genoa who lived in Dubai with his family, the Italian media reported.

item.title: Why a Nuclear Plant Is a Big Sticking Point in the Ukraine Peace Plan
item.description: The Zaporizhzhia plant, occupied by Russia, would be crucial to powering Ukraine’s postwar recovery.

item.title: There Was Probably a Flashover in the Swiss Bar Fire. Here’s What That Means.
item.description: A flashover is an event where an entire room is rapidly engulfed in flames.

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Is ‘Locked and Loaded’ if Iran Kills Protesters
item.description: Mr. Trump’s remarks that he was ready to come to the protesters’ “rescue” are a sharp escalation as protests over economic hardship turned deadly.

item.title: In the Arctic, Drones Help Identify Deadly Virus in Whales
item.description: Scientists took samples from whale blow, identifying possible disease risks for marine mammals in northern seas.
